BiblioData.Title: Probe arrangement for electrophysiological analysis in an AFM

Applicant.Name: SUISSE ELECTRONIQUE MICROTECH [CH]
CSEM CENTRE SUISSE D'ELECTRONIQUE ET DE MICROTECHNIQUE SA - RECHERCHE ET DEVELOPPEMENT

BiblioData.Abstract: A probe arrangement with a probe for local electrophysiological analysis of cells (4) such as patch-clamp techniques for use with atomic force microscopy, has a probe with a cantilever arm (2) connected to a probe holder (3). The probe has a probe tip (4) at a probing end (5) of the cantilever arm (2) and a fluid channel (6) in the cantilever arm (2) connecting a probe tip aperture (7) with a fluid reservoir (8) via a duct (9). The fluid channel (6), the duct (9) and the fluid reservoir (8) are adapted to be filled with a fluid solution (10) enabling ion transport for electrophysiological analysis. A first electrode (15) for electrophysiological analysis is placed in the fluid reservoir (8) and/or in the duct (9) and/or in the fluid channel (6).

characterized in that

a cantilever arm (2) connected to a probe holder (3);
a probe tip (4) at a probing end (5) of said cantilever arm (2);

a fluid channel (6) in the cantilever arm (2) connecting a probe tip aperture (7) with a fluid reservoir (8) via a duct (9), wherein said fluid channel (6), said duct (9) and said fluid reservoir (8) are adapted to be filled with a fluid solution (10) enabling ion transport for electrophysiological analysis,wherein a first electrode (15) is suspended in at least one of the following locations: said fluid reservoir (8); in the duct (9); and in said fluid channel (6).

8. The probe arrangement according to any of the preceding claims, wherein said probe tip (4) is -tapered and terminates in a sharp tip (22) and a probe tip aperture (7) that is arranged off-axis at the side of the tapered surface.

9. The probe arrangement according to any of the preceding claims, wherein said probe tip (4) is tapered and a probe tip aperture (7) is arranged slightly off-axis on a flattened plateau surface slightly below said sharp tip (22).

10. The Probe arrangement according to any of the preceding claims, wherein said probe arrangement is adapted to operate in a fluid environment of a fluid chamber comprising a buffer fluid (17) wherein a second electrode (16) is placed in said buffer fluid (17).

11. A method for the automatic approach and scanning of cell surfaces and the acquisition of real time topographical images of the cell (14) and features of its membrane by using a force feedback control system for controlling the probe arrangement of claim 1, wherein said method comprises the following steps:

selectably performing through at least one fluid channel (6) of said probe either one of the following: releasing and withdrawing a fluid; and

15. The method according to either one of claims 11-14 comprising the step of selectably applying electrical stimulation.
16. The method according to either one of claims 11-15 comprising the step of selectably employing an electrochemical current and voltage signal probed by said first electrode (15).
17. The method according to either one of claims 11-16 comprising the step of using the probe arrangement in contact on the sample for patch-clamp techniques.
